intro: Leschenaultia subcymosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved leschenaultia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of white to pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Leschenaultia subcymosa is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions.
